questions.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What method was used to measure the electrical conductivity of compound 1?
Is compound 1 considered a low bandgap semiconductor?
What is the highest electrical conductivity measured for compound 1 in S cm−1?
What technique was used for the fabrication of electrical contacts on compound 1?
What is the activation energy for a single crystal of compound 1 with a thickness of 645 nm?
Does the electrical conductivity of compound 1 increase with increasing temperature?
What is the estimated indirect bandgap of compound 1 in eV?
What is the main contribution to the high electrical conductivity of compound 1?
questions.answer: The integration of the (–Cu–S–)n plane in the structure

questions.question: Is compound 1 stable in air?
What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of compound 1?
questions.answer: It acts as a reducing agent for the in situ cleavage of S–S bonds

questions.question: What type of analysis confirmed the presence of Cu(I) centers in compound 1?
What is the crystal system of compound 1?
What is the role of pyrazine in the synthesis of compound 1?
questions.answer: It is used in the reaction mixture under hydrothermal conditions

questions.question: Does compound 1 exhibit semiconducting behavior?
What is the space group of compound 1?
What is the yield percentage of compound 1 based on the copper salt?
What is the thermal stability temperature of compound 1 according to TGA analysis?
What is the main structural feature of compound 1 that contributes to its high electrical conductivity?
questions.answer: The honeycomb-like arrangement of Cu and S atoms in the ab plane

questions.question: Is the electrical conductivity of compound 1 the highest among all MOFs measured in the form of a single crystal?
